00021 
00022 #ifndef _AffxSplitArray_h_
00023 #define _AffxSplitArray_h_
00024 
00029 #include "util/Convert.h"
00030 #include "util/Verbose.h"
00031 //
00032 #include <vector>
00033 //
00034 
00035 template <class TYPE, int NUM_ARRAYS = 10> class AffxSplitArray
00036 {
00037 private:
00039         std::vector<TYPE*> vData;
00041         std::vector<int> vDataSizes;
00043         int vDataSize;
00048         void allocate(int n, int narrays)
00049         {
00050                 // NB: this code assumes n >= narrays
00051                 vDataSize = n;
00052                 vDataSizes.resize(narrays);
00053                 vData.resize(narrays);
00054 
00055                 for (int i=0; i<narrays; i++)
00056                 {
00057                         vDataSizes[i] = 0;
00058                         vData[i] = NULL;
00059                 }
00060 
00061                 int entriesPerSet = n / narrays;
00062                 int nentries = 0;
00063 
00064                 //Verbose::out(1, "allocating arrays - " + ToStr(narrays));
00065                 for (int i=0; i<narrays-1; i++)
00066                 {
00067                         //Verbose::out(1, "allocating array");
00068                         vDataSizes[i] = entriesPerSet;
00069                         vData[i] = new TYPE[entriesPerSet];
00070                         nentries += entriesPerSet;
00071                 }
00072                 //Verbose::out(1, "allocating array");
00073                 vDataSizes[narrays-1] = n - nentries;
00074                 vData[narrays-1] = new TYPE[n - nentries];
00075                 //Verbose::out(1, "allocating array complete");
00076         }
00077 
00078 public:
00080         AffxSplitArray() { clear(); }
00082         ~AffxSplitArray() { clear(); }
00084         int size() const { return vDataSize; }
00088         void allocate(int n)
00089         {
00090 //#ifndef _MSC_VER
00091 //              allocate(n, 1);
00092 //#else
00093 //              allocate(n, 4);
00094 //#endif
00095                 try
00096                 {
00097                         // Try to allocate in a single vector array. If this
00098                         // succeeds then return. Failures will thown an exception.
00099                         allocate(n, 1);
00100                         return;
00101                 }
00102                 catch (...)
00103                 {
00104                         clear();
00105                 }
00106                 // The system failed to create a single array for the data.
00107                 // Try to split the allocation into NUM_ARRAYS smaller allocations
00108                 allocate(n, NUM_ARRAYS);
00109         }
00111         void clear()
00112         {
00113                 //Verbose::out(1, "clearing array");
00114                 vDataSize = 0;
00115                 vDataSizes.clear();
00116                 int n = vData.size();
00117                 for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00118                         delete[] vData[i];
00119                 vData.clear();
00120         }
00124         TYPE *getAt(int i)
00125         {
00126                 int entriesPerSet = vDataSizes[0];
00127                 int idx = i / entriesPerSet;
00128                 if (idx >= vDataSizes.size())
00129                         idx = vDataSizes.size() - 1;
00130 
00131                 i -= (entriesPerSet * idx);
00132                 return &vData[idx][i];
00133         }
00134 
00135         TYPE& operator[](int i)
00136         {
00137                 return *getAt(i);
00138         }
00139 
00140         const TYPE& operator[](int i) const
00141         {
00142                 return *getAt(i);
00143         }
00144 };
00145 
00146 
00147 #endif // _AffxArray_h_
